Roy said they would perform a screening and temperature check on each of the students that participate in each practice. Coaches would have to get creative with their workouts to get athletes back in-shape due to indoor facilities remaining closed.

"It's time to get creative let's think of ways that we can get these kids back in shape. It may not be the traditional working out in the gym or working out in the weight room, but can we do some stuff, outside that we can gather with 100 people. The football field is pretty big and we have some practice fields that are pretty big so we can spread it out," Roy said.

Keevin O'Neill, Superintendent

Congratulations to these Vicksburg Community Schools students for their innovative ideas! Taking first place from Vicksburg were Kyler Dean, Bryce Chapman and Tyler DeVries. They invented the Athletic Cleat Cover, designed to be used with all types of cleats and spikes. The purpose is to protect the sharpness of the cleats and spikes, all the while preserving the shoe’s aesthetics. They modeled the cover in CAD so it would slide over the top of a cleat to give better traction and prevent damage to flooring. CAD Drawing uses computer technology to draw or design these innovations.

Another team from Vicksburg, Linkoln Kowalski, Brayden Martin, Jacob Weeks, Landyn Buiskool and Adrian Knauer took second place for their idea to make a heated wheelchair pad. Third place went to Keagan Ellsworth, Kaeden Shubnell and Skylar Johns. Their invention was a platter and glove attached to it underneath to keep from tipping.

Wednesday 😉!

Remember this great trip? Fifteen VHS Spanish students took a 14-day Spanish immersion trip to Costa Rica under the guidance of VCS Spanish teachers Mrs. Lamers and Mrs. Rodas. The trip included a guided experience for seven days. The students participated in special activities including a painting workshop, rainforest hikes, waterfall visit, a beach day at the Pacific Ocean, hot springs experience, ziplining, a tour of an organic farm, and putting their Spanish skills to work every day! The students stayed with host families for the second week of their trip where they were able to really immerse themselves in the Costa Rican way of life! #VCSWednesdayWink
